intro: Hibbertia puberula subsp. puberula, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal or inland regions. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is known for its distinctive leaf structure. Hibbertia puberula subsp. puberula is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
